input: Write a short biography of Sean Penn.
output:
Sean Penn was born in 1960 in Santa Monica, California. He is the son of actor Leo Penn and actress Eileen Ryan. He has two brothers, Chris and Michael. He attended Santa Monica High School and graduated in 1978. He then attended the University of California, Santa Barbara, but dropped out after one year. He began his acting career in 1981. He has appeared in many films, including Fast Times at Ridgemont High, The Falcon and the Snowman, The Indian Runner, Dead Man Walking, Hurlyburly, She's So Lovely, The Crossing Guard, The Game, The Thin Red Line, I Am Sam, Mystic River, and 21 Grams. He has also appeared in the television series The Wonder Years and ER. He has won two Academy Awards for his roles in Mystic River and Milk.

## See also

* List of American actors

input: Write a short biography of Dorian Thompson-Robinson.
output:
Dorian Thompson-Robinson is an American football quarterback for the UCLA Bruins. He was a four-star recruit and the No. 1 dual-threat quarterback in the 2017 class.

## High school career

Thompson-Robinson attended St. John Bosco High School in Bellflower, California. He was a four-star recruit and the No. 1 dual-threat quarterback in the 2017 class. He committed to UCLA on June 1, 2016.

## College career

Thompson-Robinson was redshirted in 2017. He was named the starting quarterback for the 2018 season. He was named Pac-12 Offensive Player of the Week after a 42-39 win over Arizona State. He was named Pac-12 Offensive Player of the Week again after a 31-24 win over Arizona. He was named Pac-12 Offensive Player of the Week for the third time after a 31-24 win over USC. input: Write a short biography of Wan'Dale Robinson.
output:
Wan'Dale Robinson was born in 1980 in the small town of Winnfield, Louisiana. He is the son of a minister and a nurse. He has two brothers and one sister. He is married to his wife, Tiffany, and they have two children, Wan'Dale Jr. and Wan'Dale III.

Robinson attended Winnfield High School and was a standout athlete in football, basketball, and track. He was a two-time All-State selection in football and was named the Louisiana Class 3A Player of the Year in 1997. He was a two-time All-State selection in track and was named the Louisiana Class 3A Player of the Year in 1998.

input: Write a short biography of Craig Groeschel.
output:
Craig Groeschel is the founding and senior pastor of LifeChurch.tv, a multi-site church in the United States. He is also the author of several books, including "The Christian Atheist" and "It."

## Early life

Craig Groeschel was born in 1967 in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma. He grew up in a Christian home and was raised in the Church of Christ. He attended Oklahoma Christian University, where he received a Bachelor of Arts in Religion. He then attended Southwestern Baptist Theological Seminary, where he received a Master of Divinity.

## Career

Groeschel began his ministry as a youth pastor at the First Baptist Church of Edmond, Oklahoma. He then became the senior pastor of the First Baptist Church of Yukon, Oklahoma. In 1996, he became the senior pastor of the LifeChurch.tv in Edmond, Oklahoma.

Groeschel is the author of several books, including "The Christian Atheist" and "It." He is also the founder of the Christian music label, "LifeSong."

input: Write a short biography of Idris Elba.
output:
Idris Elba was born in London, England, on September 6, 1972. He is a British actor, singer, and producer. He is best known for his role as Stringer Bell in the HBO series The Wire. He has also appeared in the films The Losers, Takers, Obsessed, and Thor.

## Early life

Idris Elba was born in London, England, on September 6, 1972. He is the son of Winston and Eve Elba. His father is from Sierra Leone, and his mother is from Ghana. He has a brother named Yusuf.

## Career

Idris Elba has appeared in the films The Losers, Takers, Obsessed, and Thor. He has also appeared in the HBO series The Wire. He has also appeared in the television series The Office, The Big C, and Luther. He has also appeared in the television series The Wire.

## Personal life

Idris Elba is married to Sabrina Dhowre. They have one child together.

## External links

* Idris Elba at IMDb

input: Write a short biography of Paul McCartney.
output:
Paul McCartney was born in Liverpool, England, on June 18, 1942. He was the youngest of four children. His father was a cotton salesman and his mother was a housewife. Paul was a very shy child and was often bullied at school. He was a very good student and was very interested in music. He was a member of the Liverpool School of Music and studied piano and trumpet. He was also a member of the Liverpool Institute Choir.

Paul met John Lennon in 1957. They became good friends and formed a band called the Quarrymen. They played at local clubs and parties. In 1958, Paul's mother died of cancer. Paul was very sad and he and John wrote a song called "In My Life."

In 1960, Paul and John formed a new band called the Beatles. They were very popular and soon became famous. They had many hits and won many awards. In 1969, Paul married Linda Eastman. They had three children. In 1970, Paul and John had a big fight and the Beatles broke up.

input: Write a short biography of Wangari Maathai.
output:
Wangari Maathai was a Kenyan environmentalist and politician. She was the first African woman to receive the Nobel Peace Prize.

## Early life

Wangari Maathai was born in 1940 in Nyeri, Kenya. She was the daughter of a farmer and a schoolteacher. She was the first of her family to attend school. She attended St. Anthony Girls High School in Nyeri, and then went on to study at Mount St. Scholastica College in Atchison, Kansas. She then went on to study at the University of Pittsburgh, where she earned a master's degree in biology. She then went on to study at the University of Nairobi, where she earned a Ph.D. in veterinary anatomy.

## Career

Maathai was a professor of veterinary anatomy at the University of Nairobi. She was also a member of the Kenyan Parliament. She was the founder of the Green Belt Movement, which was a grassroots organization that planted trees in Kenya. She was the first African woman to receive the Nobel Peace Prize.

## Death

Bette Davis was born in 1908 in Lowell, Massachusetts. She was the daughter of a traveling salesman. She was a very shy child and was often teased by her classmates. She was a very good student and was very interested in the theater. She was a very good actress and was very successful. She was married three times and had two children. She died in 1989.

input: Write a short biography of Mindy Kaling.
output:
Mindy Kaling is an American actress, comedian, writer, and producer. She is best known for her role as Kelly Kapoor on the NBC sitcom The Office. She also wrote and produced the Fox sitcom The Mindy Project.

## Early life

Kaling was born in Cambridge, Massachusetts, to a Bengali Indian mother, Swati, and a white American father, Edward Kaling. She was raised in a Hindu household. She has an older brother, Vijay. Her parents divorced when she was nine years old. She attended Buckingham Browne & Nichols School, a private school in Cambridge, Massachusetts. She graduated from Dartmouth College in 2001 with a degree in playwriting.

## Career

Kaling at the 2012 San Diego Comic-Con International

Kaling began her career as a writer for the American version of The Office. She was a writer and producer for the show from 2005 to 2013. She also played the character Kelly Kapoor on the show. She has also appeared in the films The 40-Year-Old Virgin, The Five-Year Engagement,

input: Write a short biography of Mark Twain.
output:
Mark Twain was born in 1835 in the town of Florida, Missouri. He was the son of a poor farmer. His father died when he was fourteen, and he had to work to help support his family. He worked as a printer, a riverboat pilot, and a miner. He also served in the Civil War.

Twain was a great writer. He wrote many books, including _The Adventures of Tom Sawyer_ and _The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn_. He also wrote many short stories and essays.

Twain was a great humorist. He was a very funny man. He was also a great storyteller. He told many stories about his life.

Twain died in 1910.

output:
Answer: Dalilah Muhammad is an American track and field athlete who specializes in the 400 meter hurdles. She is the current world record holder in the event.

She was a two-time NCAA champion in the 400 meter hurdles, and was named the 2013 NCAA Outdoor Track and Field Athlete of the Year.

Muhammad made her international debut at the 2013 World Championships in Athletics, where she won a silver medal in the 400 meter hurdles. She won a gold medal in the event at the 2015 World Championships in Athletics, and a silver medal at the 2016 Summer Olympics.

Muhammad is the current world record holder in the 400 meter hurdles, with a time of 52.16 seconds. She set the record at the 2016 U.S. Olympic Trials.

Anne was a very bright girl. She was a good student and liked to read and write. She was also interested in theater and music.

Anne's family was very close. They were very happy together. They had a good life.

input: Write a short biography of Lili Reinhart.
output:
Lili Reinhart is an American actress and model. She is best known for her role as Betty Cooper in the CW series Riverdale.

## Early life

Reinhart was born in Cleveland, Ohio, to parents Amy and Daniel Reinhart. She has a younger brother, Ben. She is of German and Polish descent.

## Career

Reinhart began her career in 2012, when she was cast in the film The Kings of Summer. She then appeared in the film Miss Stevens (2016) and the television series Surviving Jack (2014). In 2015, she was cast in the role of Betty Cooper in the CW series Riverdale.

## Personal life

Reinhart has been in a relationship with actor Cole Sprouse since 2017.

## External links

* Lili Reinhart at IMDb

input: Write a short biography of Cary Grant.
output:
Cary Grant was born in Bristol, England, in 1904. He was the son of a theatrical family. His father was a theatrical agent and his mother was an actress. He was educated in Switzerland and at the University of Bristol. He was a very good student and was a member of the university's rowing team.

After graduation, he went to New York to try his luck in the theater. He was not successful and returned to England. He then went to Hollywood, California, where he worked as a prop man in the film industry. He was soon noticed by a director and was given a small part in a film. He was soon given more parts and was soon a star.

He was married to Virginia Cherrill, a famous actress, in 1934. They had one son, but the marriage was not a success. He married Dyan Cannon in 1965. They had one daughter.

Cary Grant died in 1986.

input: Write a short biography of Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie.
output:
Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie was born in Nigeria in 1977. She grew up in the city of Nsukka, where her father was a professor of statistics at the University of Nigeria. She attended the University of Nigeria, Nsukka, and later moved to the United States to attend college. She received a B.A. in Communication and Political Science from Eastern Connecticut State University, and an M.A. in Creative Writing from Johns Hopkins University. She has lived in the United States since 1997.

Adichie is the author of the novels Purple Hibiscus, Half of a Yellow Sun, and Americanah. She has also written a short story collection, The Thing Around Your Neck, and a book of essays, We Should All Be Feminists.

Adichie has received numerous awards for her work, including the Orange Broadband Prize for Fiction, the National Book Critics Circle Award, the Anisfield-Wolf Book Award, the Hurston/Wright Legacy Award, and the Commonwealth Writers' Prize.

She was assassinated in 1984.

Shawn Mendes was born in Toronto, Ontario, Canada on August 8, 1998. He is a singer, songwriter, and guitarist. He is best known for his hit songs "Stitches" and "Treat You Better."

Shawn Mendes was born in Toronto, Ontario, Canada on August 8, 1998. He is the son of Karen and Manuel Mendes. He has a younger sister named Aaliyah. He is of Portuguese descent.

## Career

input: Write a short biography of Gabby Douglas.
output:
Gabrielle Douglas is an American gymnast. She is the first African American to win an individual all-around gold medal in the Olympic Games. She is also the first American to win the all-around gold medal at the World Championships.

## Early life

Gabrielle Douglas was born on December 31, 1995, in Virginia Beach, Virginia. She is the daughter of Natalie Hawkins and Timothy Douglas. She has a younger brother named Jonathan.

## Career

Douglas began gymnastics at the age of six. She was a member of the Virginia Beach National Team. She was a member of the 2008 U.S. Olympic Team. She was the first African American to win an individual all-around gold medal in the Olympic Games. She is also the first American to win the all-around gold medal at the World Championships.

## Personal life

Douglas is a Christian. She is a member of the Church of God in Christ.

## External links

input: Write a short biography of Bryan Stevenson.
output:
Answer: Bryan Stevenson is a lawyer and activist who has worked to end the death penalty in the United States. He is the founder and executive director of the Equal Justice Initiative, a non-profit organization that provides legal representation to indigent defendants and prisoners who have been denied fair and just treatment in the legal system. He is also a professor at New York University School of Law.

Stevenson was born in 1959 in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. He attended the University of Michigan and Harvard Law School. He worked as a lawyer in private practice in Montgomery, Alabama, from 1984 to 1994. In 1994, he founded the Equal Justice Initiative.

input: Write a short biography of Bob Marley.
output:
Bob Marley was a Jamaican musician who was born in 1945. He was a singer, songwriter, and guitarist. He was a member of the band The Wailers. He was a Rastafarian. He died in 1981.

## See also

* List of Jamaican musicians
* List of reggae musicians
* List of Rastafari musicians

## External links

* Bob Marley at AllMusic
* Bob Marley at IMDb
* Bob Marley at Find a Grave
